discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C - is correct
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thin_provisioning

questions.question_text:
A customer needs to spin-up 20 new VMs on a web cluster.
Which of the following would help the customer use small amounts of storage per VM on a private cloud when creating each new VM in the environment?

choices.D: Copy the known_hosts file contents to the client
choices.E: Copy the known_hosts file contents to the server
choices.B: Copy the id_rsa file contents to the server
choices.A: Copy the id_rsa.pub file contents to the server
choices.C: Use ssh-add to install the id_rsa.pub on the client

comments.content: I agree but I hate how they leave out specifics like where they generated the key from, if they specifically said on the client side it makes it a lot clearer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A-
id_rsa is the private key. You should copy the public key, wich is id_rsa.pub

A user creates a key pair to configure RSA authentication on a Linux server.
Which of the following should the user do NEXT?

discussion.content:

E and F all the way
VNC? Also says to only choose two.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are Linux desktop environments? (Choose two.)
A new corporate policy states that Bluetooth should be disabled on all company laptops. Which of the following commands would disable the use of Bluetooth?

discussion.content: The question is asking how to disable the module. I understand blocking it from even installing or running, but wouldn’t disable have a different command? https://access.redhat.com/solutions/2682931

Selected Answer: A
should be A !

Selected Answer: A
A just seems so right.

Selected Answer: A
A. echo “blacklist bluetooth” > /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-bluetooth
B. echo “kill bluetooth” > /etc/modprobe.d/kill-bluetooth
C. echo “modprobe bluetooth” > /etc/modprobe.d/modporbe-bluetooth
D. echo “rmmod bluetooth” > /etc/modprobe.d/rmmod-bluetooth

Right answer is "A". https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/98718/does-modprobe-d-blacklist-always-need-the-prefix-blacklist

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

discussion.content:

XRDP use port 3389
